page.title: 08The Post Office Stores
page.content: The Post Office stores was built in Woolton Hill in the early nineteenth century. Before the Post Office opened there were two cottages. Mr.and Mrs Toal bought the shop in 1975. Nearly forty people have owned the shop before Mr. and Mrs Toal.Some people shop at the post office when they forget provisions at Newbury but some people without transport use the shop regularly. About two hundred to three hundred people come into the post office stores each day for groceries and stamps. Shop lifting is a problem in the shop, it has existed for ten years. Two people have been caught, and they do know of others who have not been prosecuted yet.
